primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from paralysis/despair (death-logic) to political/ecological resistance (resurrection-logic) through the example of Mary Magdalene.

subject.identificatie: The Hearer/The 'We' (specifically women as the vanguard).
tekstueel_bewijs: Klagen und Weinen muss ich erst noch lernen.
Wir können die Selbstversorgungswirtschaft ausmalen, und wir können damit anfangen.
Ich suche Gerechtigkeit, ich suche Frieden...
Alternative zum Tod gibt, nämlich die Selbstversorgungswirtschaft

zender.identificatie: The Tradition/The 'X-Factor' (A historical stream of hope).
tekstueel_bewijs: Wir haben eine Tradition. Uns ist etwas überkommen.
Die jüdisch-christliche Tradition gibt Anleitung zum Klagen.

ontvanger.identificatie: The World/The Oppressed (The 'Two-Thirds World', the environment).
tekstueel_bewijs: Gott will, dass alle Menschen in Gerechtigkeit leben.
damit alle im Frieden mit der Natur... leben können.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

helper.identificatie: Jesus (as a visionary model) and the Holy Spirit (as motivation).
tekstueel_bewijs: Er hat mir gesagt, dass Gottes Wille stärker ist...
Der Geist wird euch helfen, wenn ihr mutlos seid.

tegenstander.identificatie: The 'Death-Logic' of Capitalism, Patriarchy, and Nuclear Power.
tekstueel_bewijs: die mächtigen Männer in der kapitalistischen Industrie und im Militär
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is structural and political rather than ontological or spiritual (sin as power).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The historical Mary Magdalene finding the empty tomb.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Mary Magdalene
secundair_narratief_programma.object: The Body of Jesus / Recognition of the Risen Lord
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The biblical narrative is used as a psychological mirror for the preacher's political agenda rather than the ground of it.

voorbeelden_god_subject: Gott will, dass alle Menschen in Gerechtigkeit leben.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Ich muss lernen, zu weinen wie Maria Magdalena.

voorbeelden: Klagen und Weinen muss ich erst noch lernen.
Wir müssen den Sinn des Lebens schließlich nicht produzieren.
Ich will mich nicht zum Schweigen bringen lassen.
Dazu ist eine klare politische Analyse notwendig.
Ich weiß mir nicht anders zu helfen, als...
Er macht uns fähig zur Liebe.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a recruitment for a political movement. It focuses on awakening the will (Vouloir) and the obligation to act (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resurrection is redefined as the human power to organize life differently.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is taken seriously as a political threat, but not as a spiritual state requiring divine intervention.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is anthropocentric. Resurrection is not an act of God upon a dead man, but a 'process' that humans 'spread' through alternative lifestyles.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Gott ist stark in ihr... Sie war frei... aufgrund ihrer Verbundenheit mit Gott.
Wer heute weitererzählt... der partizipiert an Christi Auferstehung.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Der Geist wird euch helfen, wenn ihr mutlos seid.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Mary Magdalene is the 'brave' model for the modern protester.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Mary is a witness to an act she did not cause; the focus should be on the Christ who conquers death, not Mary's courage.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform 'resurrection' via lifestyle choices (baking bread, political activism).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The biblical text is a springboard for a pre-existing political narrative.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'Don't touch me' (Noli me tangere) and the sermon's focus on physical/economic 'touching' of the world.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Christi Auferstehung setzt Auferstehungsprozesse in Gang... wir werden die Nachricht verbreiten.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides motivation for the task the human already knows they must do.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is identified with 'Capitalism' and 'Patriarchy' rather than a condition of the heart.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a call to arms where God is the 'X-Factor' fuel for human engines.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The preacher and the congregation are the subjects of 'resurrection'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Christ the subject who raises the dead congregation.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'I must learn to weep,' use 'Christ meets us in our inability to even weep.'

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as 'Dead Man/Woman' being called out of the grave.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on the word 'Maria' spoken by Jesus as the creative act.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on the 'Noli me tangere' as God's transcendence that saves us from our own failed projects.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Death as the 'Last Enemy' that no self-sufficiency can defeat.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Without a cosmic opponent, the 'resurrection' becomes a mere lifestyle improvement.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Christ is risen) → Ethics (Therefore we act).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has high rhetorical passion but risks exhausting the hearer by making them the engine of their own salvation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, it is powerful and inclusive; actantially, it is a heavy burden of Law.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis is replaced by 'eisegesis' where Mary is a cipher for feminist-socialist ideals.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Exposes that despite the word 'Resurrection', the actantial subject remains the human ego.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Political Theology' where the narrative structure is entirely horizontal.
